title: Component Specification
description: YAML schema for specifying entities and flows. Each entity/flow captures applicable attacks and defenses. It also captures components that make up the entity/flow. Each component is another entity/flow with its own set of specifications.

design-document.description: Document (path) containing design details about this specification.

base.description: Base human specification from which additional properties are inherited.

roles.description: Roles this human plays in the threat model. Each role is another human specification defined elsewhere.

client-program.description: Program used by the human to interact with the system (for example, a browser).

recommendations.description: A freeform, adhoc list of security recommendations for this human. NOTE: Use this only when a formal set of attacks and defenses cannot be defined for this human.

adm.description:
List of attack/defense specifications for this human. Attacks are directed towards the human and defenses are mitigations employed by the human to deal with attacks.

Each item in the list can be text containing attacks and defenses or an '.adm' file. In case of files, they must exist in the same path as this specification.

repo.description: Path to the code repository of this program

base.description: Base entity specification from which additional properties are inherited.

languages.description: Programming language(s) this entity is written in.

recommendations.description: A freeform, adhoc list of security recommendations for this entity. NOTE: Use this only when a formal set of attacks and defenses cannot be defined for this entity.

adm.description:
List of attack/defense specifications for this program. Attacks are directed towards this entity and defenses are controls implemented in the entity to block/mitigate attacks.  If you are grouping attacks/defenses into STRIDE categories, all 6 categories are applicable for a program.

Each item in the list can be text containing attacks and defenses or an '.adm' file. In case of files, they must exist in the same path as this specification.

type.description: This specification is about a flow

base-protocol.description: Protocol this flow is based on. Base protocol is another flow specification defined elsewhere.

protocol-stack.description: Protocol stack underlying this flow (excluding the 'base-protocol')

recommendations.description: A freeform, adhoc list of security recommendations for this flow. NOTE: Use this only when a formal set of attacks and defenses cannot be defined for this flow.

adm.description:
List of attack/defense specifications for this flow. Attacks are directed towards this flow and defenses are controls implemented by the flow (typically in the protocol) to mitigate attacks. If you are grouping attacks/defenses into STRIDE categories, only 'Tampering', 'Info. Disclosure' and 'Denial of Service' are applicable.

Each item in the list can be text containing attacks and defenses or an '.adm' file. In case of files, they must exist in the same path as this specification.
